page.title: 03VILLAGE OF KEMPSFORD
page.content: { Kempsford}is basically ribbon development along its main street and the west end falls within this survey. Older development around the church and 19th century development alongside the old canal's quay and a modern estate are outside this survey which includes the village hall, primary school and an old inn, The Axe and Compass (owned by Messrs Courage), the entrance of which is much below present road level. Houses are stone with slate roofs, with tiled modern houses and bungalows of reconstituted {Cotswold}stone infilling. There are only two red-brick buildings amidst the mellow{Cotswold}colouring. There are two farms, a builders yard and a haulage contractors. Approximately 40% work locally or are retired whilst the others commute.
